title: I-35E Dallas construction

pageHeader.title: I-35E Horseshoe Project, 2014 and 2015
pageHeader.lastUpdated: February 1, 2018 (update for completion of Horseshoe project)

text: The I-35E Trinity River bridges were replaced during the Horseshoe Project which completed in 2017.

images.caption: Piers for the new northbound bridges.

The existing northbound bridge is on the left, new bridges on the right. The existing northbound bridge was originally Cadiz street and was converted to the northbound freeway lanes for the 1959 opening of the freeway.
Beam segments were positioned with open gaps.
Here is a short beam section positioned next to a longer section with an open gap.
The open gaps where then filled in.
Piers for the new southbound bridge.
Looking northbound on the original bridge (which was later demolished), with piers for new bridges on both sides.
